thread.title: Long Island Fall Festival has 4 days of events in Huntington
thread.title_full: Long Island Fall Festival has 4 days of events in Huntington | Newsday

author: LYNN PETRY
title: Long Island Fall Festival has 4 days of events in Huntington
text:
Huntington's annual outdoor festival is a four-day affair in and around Heckscher Park that's brimming with vendors, entertainment, rides and lots of things to eat. Here's what you need to know.
WHEN|WHERE 5-10 p.m. Friday, Oct. 9; 11 a.m.-10 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 10 and Sunday, Oct. 11; 11 a.m.-5 p.m. Monday, Oct. 12 along Prime Avenue and Route 25A, Huntington
Most popular Hillary Clinton plays bartender on 'SNL' premiere Grateful Dead to play free NYC show Robin Williams' widow, kids settle estate fight Batmobile returns to Gotham for NYC exhibit Halloween movies, TV shows to watch now INFO 631-423-6100, lifallfestival.com
See also Family fall festivals on LI ADMISSION Free
FOOD
The festival features two international food courts serving traditional street fair goodies (think zeppoles and sausage heroes) but also Mexican, French and Latin dishes. What's more, the festival has its own beer and wine tent. New this year is a coffeehouse-style cafe that will keep patrons powered with java.
ENTERTAINMENT
There's a full midway with carnival rides and games. Four stages around the park offer live music. There's a meatball-eating contest Saturday -- sign up in advance online. Kids will find a petting zoo, pony rides and face-painting.
PARKING
Ten municipal lots and metered spaces around the village offer parking during the festival. Consider parking for free at the Huntington Long Island Rail Road station and hopping the shuttle bus ($1 round-trip).
